tuv.seg: Customs and Excise officers - powers to search travellers' baggage
Oifigigh Chustaim agus Máil - cearta chun bagáiste taistealaithe a chuardach
Selective checks to protect society
Seiceáil roghnach chun an tsochaí a chosaint
Customs and Excise officers are allowed to carry out checks on imported goods (including personal baggage) to prevent the smuggling of dutiable, excisable or prohibited goods

Tá cead ag oifigigh Chustaim agus Máil scrúdú a dhéanamh ar earraí allmhairithe (bagáiste pearsanta san áireamh) chun smuigleáil earraí a bhfuil dleacht nó mál ag baint leo, nó earraí cosctha, a sheachaint
These checks are carried out routinely on travellers arriving from outside the EU or from outside the EU via an EU Member State
Déantar na scrúduithe seo go rialta ar thaistealaithe atá ag teacht ó áiteanna lasmuigh den AE nó ó áiteanna taobh amuigh den AE via ballstát den AE
These travellers are required to make a Customs declaration
Caithfidh na taistealaithe seo dearbhú custaim a dhéanamh

If you are arriving in Ireland from outside the EU via an EU Member State, you must make a Customs declaration unless all your baggage was cleared by Customs officers at your first airport or point of arrival in the EU

Má tá tú ag teacht go hÉirinn ó áit taobh amuigh den AE via ballstát den AE, ní foláir duit dearbhú custaim a dhéanamh muna raibh do bhagáiste uilig imréitithe ag oifigigh chustaim ag an gcéad aerfort nó ionad teachta a shroich tú san AE. (Ta rialacháín faoi rialú airgid thirim

(Cash controls require that if you are entering or leaving the European Union and carrying €10,000 or more cash you must make a special declaration to the Customs authority of the member state you are entering or leaving.)

Má bíonn tu ag teacht istigh nó ag dul lasmuigh den AE le €10,000 airgead tirim nó níos mó, caithfidh tú dearbhú custaim speisialta a dhéanamh don údarás custaim an bhallstáit ina bhfuil tú ag teacht nó ag fáil.)
If all of your baggage was cleared by Customs officers upon your arrival in the EU, you can proceed through the Blue Channel
Má bhí do bhagáiste uilig imréitithe ag oifigigh chustaim nuair a shroich tú an AE, d'fhéadfá dul tríd an mBealach Gorm
Customs declarations are usually done by means of the Red/Green Channel system
De ghnáth déantar dearbhú custaim trí chóras na Bealaí Dearga/Uaithne
Travellers should go through the Red Channel if:
Ba cheart do thaistealaithe dul tríd an mBealach Dearg má:
• They have more than the allowances that they are entitled to, or
• Tá níos mó ciondála acu ná mar atá ceadaithe nó
• They are in doubt about whether they have more than the permitted allowances or
• Tá amhras orthu an bhfuil níos mó ciondála acu ná mar atá ceadaithe nó
• They have prohibited or restricted goods
• Tá earraí cosctha nó srianta acu
Travellers should go through the Green Channel if they have:
Ba cheart do thaistealaithe dul tríd an mBealach Uaithne:
• Only the allowances that they are permitted and
• Muna bhfuil acu ach an méid ciondála ceadaithe
• No prohibited or restricted goods
• Nuair nach bhfuil earraí cosctha nó srianta acu
Travellers arriving from outside the EU may be questioned and their baggage may be examined
D'fhéadfadh taistealaithe ag teacht ó áiteanna lasmuigh den AE a bheith ceistithe agus a mbagáiste a bheith curtha faoi scrúdú
Travellers arriving from within the EU are not required to make a Customs declaration and should proceed through the Blue Channel
Ní chaithfidh taistealaithe atá ag teacht ó áiteanna taobh istigh den AE dearbhú custaim a dhéanamh agus ba cheart dóibh dul ar aghaidh tríd an mBealach Gorm
However, Customs officers have the power to question these travellers if there is reason to doubt that they have arrived from an EU Member State
Tá cead ag oifigigh chustaim, áfach, na taistealaithe seo a cheistiú má tá amhras ann ar tháinig siad ó bhallstáit den AE nó nár tháinig

Customs officers may also intervene if they have reason to believe that prohibited or restricted goods (including drugs) are being imported/exported or if they believe an offence in respect of excisable products is being committed

Tá cead ag oifigigh chustaim a ladar a chur isteach má cheapann siad go bhfuil earraí cosctha nó srianta (drugaí san áireamh) dhá allmhairiú/onnmhairiú nó má cheapann siad go bhfuil coir i dtaobh earraí a bhfuil mál orthu dhá déanamh
These procedures are in place to help protect society and to guard against tax or duty fraud
Tá na modhanna oibre seo i bhfeidhm chun an tsochaí a chosaint agus calaois ioncaim a sheachaint
Travellers may be searched by Customs officers only where an officer has reason to suspect that they are:
Níl cead ag oifigigh chustaim cuardach a dhéanamh ar thaistealaithe ach amháin nuair atá cúis ag an oifigeach amhras a bheith aige go bhfuil siad:
• Carrying uncustomed or prohibited goods (uncustomed goods are goods that are imported over and above the personal traveller's allowance and that are not declared to Customs) or

• Ag iompar earraí gan custam, nó earraí cosctha (ciallaíonn earraí gan custam earraí atá allmhairithe os cionn an méid ciondála pearsanta atá ceadaithe don taistealaí agus nach bhfuil dearbhaithe don údarás custaim) nó
• Carrying drugs on their person
• Ag iompar drugaí orthu féin

In cases where a Customs officer suspects that the person is carrying uncustomed or prohibited goods, he or she must go before a superior officer of the Customs and Excise service who will decide whether there are sufficient grounds for the search to be carried out

I gcásanna ina gceapann oifigeach custaim go bhfuil an duine ag iompar earraí gan custam nó earraí cosctha, ní foláir dó/di dul chuig oifigeach sinsearach na seirbhíse Custaim agus Máil a dhéanfaidh cinneadh an bhfuil dóthain cúise ann chun cuardach a dhéanamh
In practice, most searches are carried out by Customs officers in respect of drugs
I ndáiríre, déantar cuardach an chuid is mó den am i dtaobh drugaí
If you are to be searched on suspicion of carrying drugs:
Má táthar chun cuardach a dhéanamh ort de bharr amhrais go bhfuil tú ag iompar drugaí:
• You must understand the reason for the search
• Ní foláir duit fáth an chuardaigh a thuiscint
It has been known for drug smugglers to use people with disabilities or children to carry drugs
Tarlaíonn sé go n-úsáideann smuigléirí daoine faoi mhí-chumas nó páistí chun drugaí a iompar
If Customs officers are required to search a child or a person with a disability, it is done in the presence of a parent or guardian
Má chaithfidh oifigigh chustaim cuardach a dhéanamh ar pháiste nó ar dhuine faoi mhíchumas, déantar é seo i láthair tuismitheora nó caomhnóra
• You can only be searched by an officer of the same sex
• Ní fhéadfadh ach oifigeach den ghnéas céanna cuardach a dhéanamh ort

• No person of the opposite sex can be present where the search involves the removal of clothing other than hat, coat jacket, gloves or similar articles of clothing unless the presence of the person is necessary as a result of your violent conduct

• Ní fhéadfadh duine ar bith den ghnéas eile a bheith i láthair nuair a chaithfidh tú éadaí a bhaint díot, taobh amuigh de hata, cóta, seaicéad, lámhaínní nó ball éadaigh eile cosúil leo sin, ach amháin sa chás go gcaithfidh an duine sin a bheith i láthair mar gheall ar d'iompar foréigneach
• You have the right to request that the search be carried out by a medical practitioner
• Tá an ceart agat iarratas a dhéanamh go ndéanfaidh dochtúir an cuardach
• The search must be conducted in a room to which the public does not have free access
• Ní foláir an cuardach a dhéanamh i seomra nach bhfuil bealach isteach don phobal ann
Windows must be screened and doors secured to ensure complete privacy
Ní foláir scáthláin a chur ar na fuinneoga agus glas a chur ar na doirse chun a bheith cinnte go bhfuil príobháideachas iomlán ann
• If you refuse to be searched, you may be arrested without warrant by the Customs officer and may be prosecuted
• Má dhiúltaíonn tú cead cuardaigh a thabhairt, d'fhéadfá a bheith gafa ag an oifigeach custaim gan barántas agus d'fhéadfaí an dlí a chur ort
If you are arrested by Customs officers, you will be taken to the nearest police station to be charged with an offence
Má tá tú gafa ag oifigigh chustaim, tabharfar go dtí an stáisiún Garda is gaire thú chun a bheith cúisithe i leith coire
• If Customs officers find controlled drugs, you may prosecuted
• Má fhaigheann oifigigh chustaim drugaí srianta, d'fhéadfá a bheith cúisithe
You may be arrested or proceeded against later by summons
D'fheadfá a bheith gafa nó d'fhéadfadh sé tarlú go gcuirfí an dlí ort níos deireanaí le toghairm
Customs officers keep records of all searches that they conduct
Coinníonn oifigigh chustaim taifid de na cuardaigh go léir a dhéanann siad
Additionally, everyone detained by Customs officers has the right of:
Chomh maith leis sin, tá na ceartanna seo a leanas ag gach duine atá coinnithe ag oifigigh custaim:
• Informing a relative/third party of their situation
• Duine gaolmhar/triú duine a chur ar an eolas maidir leis an gcás ina bhfuil siad
If you feel you have been unfairly treated by Customs officers you may make a complaint - see "How to apply" below
Má cheapann tú nach bhfuair tú cothrom na Féinne ó na hoifigigh chustaim, d'fhéadfá gearán a dhéanamh - féach "Conas iarratas a dhéanamh" thíos
A pat down search involves a search of outer clothing without the removal of clothing
Tugtar cuardach eadaí seachtracha ar chuardach éadaí amuigh, gan éadaí a bhaint
An intimate body search may involve the removal and search of clothing and a visual examination of the undressed person by an officer or medical practitioner to verify if drugs are being concealed

D'fhéadfadh éadaí a bhaint díot, iad a chuardú agus súilscrúdú a dhéanamh ar an duine nocht ag oifigeach nó dochtúir, a bheith i gceist le dlúthchuardach coirp chun a fháil amach an bhfuil drugaí ceilte
You cannot be subjected to an intimate body search for drugs unless:
Ní féidir dlúthchuardach coirp a dhéanamh ort chun drugaí a fháil ach amháin:
• Customs officers have reasonable cause to suspect that you are in possession of a controlled drug
• Nuair atá fáth ag oifigigh chustaim amhras a bheith orthu go bhfuil druga srianta i do sheilbh agat
Customs officers do not carry out internal body searches
Ní dhéanann oifigigh chustaim cuardaigh coirpe taobh istigh
Penalties for carrying uncustomed goods
Pionóis i dtaobh earraí gan custam a iompar
The penalties for carrying uncustomed goods are generally three times the duty paid value of the goods in question
De ghnáth, is é luach na n-earraí le dleacht íochta faoi thrí an pionós a ghearrtar ar iompar earraí gan custam
The goods are also liable to forfeiture and can be seized along with any other articles used for concealing or conveying the uncustomed goods or packed with them

D'fhéadfadh na hearraí a bheith forghéillte agus is féidir iad a ghábháil chomh maith le nithe ar bith eile a úsáideadh chun na hearraí gan custam a cheilt nó a iompar, nó rudaí a bhí pacáilte ina dteannta
Penalties for carrying illegal drugs
Pionóis i dtaobh iompair drugaí mí-dleathacha
The penalties for smuggling illegal drugs are set out in the Misuse of Drugs Act , as amended
Leagtar amach na pionóis i dtaobh smuigleáil drugaí mí-dleathacha san Acht um Mhí-Úsáid Drugaí, leasaithe

These penalties range from a fine in the case of a person convicted of importing a drug such as cannabis for personal use to life imprisonment for the most serious offences, which concern the importation of drugs for supply to others

Tá réimse pionós i bhfeidhm ó fhíneáil i gcás duine chiontaithe i leith allmhairithe druga ar nós cannabas chun úsáid phearsanta a bhaint as, go dtí príosún saoil do na cionta is tromchúisí, a bhaineann le hallmhairiú drugaí chun iad a sholáthar do dhaoine eile

If you have any information in relation to drug smuggling in Ireland (pdf), you can send a completed Customs Drugs Watch report form to Customs Drugs Law Enforcement- see "Where to apply" (Remember to clearly mark "FREEPOST" on the envelope.)

Má bionn aon eolas agat faoi smuigleáil drugaí (pdf) is féidir foirm thuarisce Faire Drugai Custaim comhlánaithe a sheoladh do Forfheidhmiú an Dlí Custam a Bhaineann le Drugaí – féach ‘Cá háit a dhéanfaidh mé iarratas’ thios. (Ba chóir duit ‘Saorphoist’ a chur ar an cludach.)
If you feel you have been the victim of unfair treatment at the hands of Customs officers, you should complain at the relevant time to the Collector or other local manager
Má cheapann tú gur fhulaing tú úsáid mhí-chothrom ó oifigigh Chustaim, ba cheart duit gearán a dhéanamh ag an am cuí leis an mBailitheoir nó le bainisteoir áitiúil eile
If you are unhappy with the response, you can ask to have your complaint referred to the Customer Service Manager in the relevant Region/District
Má tá tú míshásta leis an bhfreagra, is féidir leat gearán a dhéanamh leis an mBainisteoir Seirbhíse Custaiméara sa Réigiún / Dúiche ábhartha
Revenue have published a leaflet (CS4) on their complaint and review procedures (pdf)
Foilsithe ag na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim bileog (CS4) ar a nósanna imeachta gearán agus athbhreithnithe (pdf)
